title: BBC Local Live: Birmingham & the Black Country on Wednesday 8 June 2016 - BBC News
summary: hospitals among buildings deluged with water .
emergency services receive hundreds of call-outs .

documents.title: latest weather for the west midlands
text: latest weather for the west midlands

documents.title: notts post 400 again in win over bears
text: notts post 400 again in win over bears

documents.title: our updates from across wednesday
text: thanks to everyone who shared their photos with us .
we 'll be back with the latest updates from 08:00 on thursday morning bringing you news from across birmingham and the black country .
if you 'd like to share any of your flooding photos with us between now and then , email us , tweet us or reach us on the bbc wm facebook page .
listen live to bbc wm for the latest updates and watch midlands today .
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: collapsing walls among fire service call-outs
text: it 's been a busy afternoon for emergency crews after flash flooding across the region .
west midlands fire service has pulled together a rundown of some of the calls it 's received over the past five hours .
- one woman `` rescued from floating car ''
- collapsed walls (
- flooding at hospitals
- drivers stuck in vehicles
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sandwell hospital lift shafts flooded
text: three fire crews are at sandwell hospital after six of its lift shafts flooded .
the fire service said it received a 999 call at about 17:00 reporting flood water coming into the building .
an estimated 20,000 litres of water are thought to have entered the building and crews are expected to remain at the hospital into this evening .
the hospital says some patient areas have been evacuated so they can be assessed and cleaned .
we would like to thank everyone for their understanding whilst we deal with the situation and applaud our staff for their swift response in maintaining service under challenging circumstances

documents.title: flooding round-up : people stranded ; roads ruptured ; hospital among flooded buildings
text: i 've just spoken to the duty station commander at west midlands fire service , who says crews have been extremely busy since heavy rainfall at 16:30 this afternoon .
call-outs have included :
- people stranded in cars
- reports of roads rupturing
- flooded properties
- two crews are also at birmingham 's city hospital , after a burst pipe leaked into the maternity unit .
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: emergency services set up incident centre after hundreds of 999 calls
text: west midlands police has received nearly 1,000 999 calls since 16:00 , when the heavy rainfall started across birmingham and the black country .
a spokesman for the fire service says they received more than 400 calls in the space of three hours .
an incident room has been set up by west midlands fire service to keep across the situation in the region , as crews attempt to remove water from properties .
we have added nearly 1000 incidents onto our system since 1600 today .
we are extremely busy across the force area .
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wulfrun centre flooded in torrential downpoar
text: wolverhampton 's wulfrun centre is clearing up this evening after being partially flooded during the earlier downpour .
the shopping centre was shut at 16:30 after water came into the main entrance and through roof vents .
colin quinton , centre manager , said drains outside could not cope with the volume of water .
the roof vents , which operate on a sensor , could not close quickly enough to stop the rain coming in .
the centre will open tomorrow at 09:00 as normal , he added .
author: Caroline Gall
BBC News Online

documents.title: photo : turnberry road flooding in great barr

documents.title: roads swamped and a shopping centre evacuated
text: torrential rain brought chaos to the roads and trains in the west midlands today as downpours swept across the region - with water even pouring through the roof of wolverhampton 's wulfrun centre .
author: Express and Star

documents.title: maternity unit at city hospital floods
text: firefighters are at birmingham 's city hospital after flash flooding in its delivery ward .
a spokesman for the fire service tells me they were called to dudley road after flooding and a number of crews are at the scene .
it 's not yet known if patients are affected .
white watch finishing the shift 90mins late dealing with a severe flooding at city hospital in the delivery ward .

documents.title: buses delayed between 60 and 90 minutes
text: buses in the west midlands will see delays of between 60 and 90 minutes due to flash flooding .
engineers are working hard to clear tracks of debris .
i assumed that would be the case , but really what we 're after is a vague indication of how long it might take .
# bus delays of between 60-90min on bus services across # birmingham and the # blackcountry .
some routes diverting

documents.title: school closure due to serious flood damage
text: holyhead school , in handsworth , birmingham , says it will be closed tomorrow to all students , except years 11 , 12 and 13 .
it says examinations and lessons will continue as normal for these students and the closure is due to serious flood damage .

text: great barr has been severely affected by flash flooding this afternoon as heavy showers started at about 16:00 .

ladywood and west bromwich crews tweeted these photos .
ladywood crews busy with weather related calls

text: west midlands fire service is dealing with at least 14 flash flooding related incidents in the birmingham and black country area .
mark masterson took this video in west bromwich a little while ago .

and i feel for one of our reporters , who got a little too close to standing water on the hagley road in birmingham .

Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: footballer 's widow and polio campaigner dies
text: the widow of former birmingham city footballer jeff hall , who inspired the nation to get vaccinated against polio after the death of her husband , has died .
following the unexpected death of her husband , dawn clements ( centre ) put herself in the spotlight and encouraged people to be vaccinated
her work has been recognised as a key factor in helping the nation wipe out the disease .
her funeral is taking place next thursday , at st alphege church in solihull .
author: Louise Hancock
Newsreader, BBC WM

documents.title: snow leopard dies giving birth to cub
text: snow leopard dies giving birth to cub

documents.title: hotel death woman named
text: a woman who was found dead in a lichfield hotel room last weekend has been formally identified .
author: Lichfield Mercury

documents.title: continue registering to vote in eu referendum , david cameron says
text: david cameron has urged people to continue to register to vote after an online glitch ahead of the eu referendum registration deadline .
the prime minister tweeted a link to the sign-up page and said `` urgent discussions '' were taking place to ensure people who register can vote .
the electoral commission called for the registration deadline to be extended .
the problems lasted from 22:15 bst on tuesday until after the midnight deadline .
follow live updates on the eu referendum .
if you are n't registered & you want to vote in this eu referendum you should continue to register at

trade will still be there markets dictate this and not politicians
leaving the free trade area will dictate the loss in uk sales .

our biggest export is services .

actually yes there is a power to amend the date in the act itself by statutory instrument
so why do you contest the legality ?
the change can and will have retroactive effect

documents.title: better in or out ? a referendum special on bbc one
text: leading figures from the leave and remain campaigns in the west midlands debate the issues around the eu referendum in front of a studio audience .
join us this sunday from 22:35 on bbc one .

Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: burntwood pensioner , 78 , conned out of cash

documents.title: patient survives end-of-life care plan
text: patient survives end-of-life care plan

documents.title: blues restructuring plans 'significant , ' says club director
text: blues club director panos pavlakis believes yesterday 's announcement to the hong kong stock exchange is an ' '' important and significant '' step .
an extraordinary general meeting has been called for next month , with a sale potentially completed by october .
paul suen , the man behind trillion trophy asia limited is set to take a majority stake .
author: BBC WM Sport

documents.title: snow leopard cub to be hand-reared
text: a snow leopard at dudley zoo has died after giving birth to her third cub .
nanga , aged seven , was brought to the black country zoo in 2010 from the czech republic as part of a breeding programme .
the leopard 's first cub nidara ( died in july 2013 after developing an infection .
her second cub , called makalu , is soon to be moved to its native india , a spokeswoman tells me .
milo , who was born on monday , will be hand-reared by dudley zoo 's senior keeper , sarah evans .
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

text: theatregoers in the west end of london have given a standing ovation to the first public performance of harry potter and the cursed child , which stars birmingham 's cherelle skeete .
the call the midwife actress plays rose granger-weasley in the latest installment in j.k rowling 's magical saga .

documents.title: latest headlines : woman 's end-of-life care plan criticised ; cyclist left 'terrified ' after dog attack
text: the top stories in the bbc wm newsroom this lunchtime include :
- the family of a 77-year-old dementia patient who was twice put on an end-of-life care plan by sandwell hospital but survived , say they 're disgusted with the hospital
- a man from bilston says he 's been left terrified as he was savaged by a dog while cycling to work
- one of dudley zoo 's snow leopards has died
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

text: dog jumped 'like bullet out of gun '

documents.title: birmingham parade of champions launched

british athletics has launched its walk of stars at the alexander stadium this morning .
commonwealth heptathlon gold medallist kelly sotherton launches the birmingham parade of champions .
@ twitterid
author: Nick Clitheroe
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: dudley zoo snow leopard dies giving birth
text: one of dudley zoo 's snow leopards has died , the zoo announces .
nanga died due to complications while giving birth to a male cub , milo , ( is now being hand reared .
sad to announce the death of # snowleopard nanga , but we welcome cub , milo
sad loss .
such a beautiful animal !
i saw her last week while on a family day out rest in peace nanga glad baby milo is okay

that is such sad news , sympathy to the keepers & fingers crossed for dad & cub .

documents.title: warning of heavy rain
text: the met office has issued a yellow warning for heavy , thundery showers this afternoon and evening across the west midlands .
while most will avoid the showers , there is the potential for a few isolated heavy , thundery bursts that could lead to tricky driving conditions and localised flooding .
a yellow severe weather warning for # rain has been issued : stay # weatheraware @ twitterid
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: cyclist 'terrified ' by dog attack
text: cyclist 'terrified ' by dog attack

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast for the west midlands
text: charlie slater looks ahead to what 's in store for us over the next 24-hours .

documents.title: cricket : warwickshire beat leicestershire
text: warwickshire beat leicestershire at edgbaston in emphatic style in the royal london one day cup .
sam hain hit an unbeaten 105 off 124 balls to help them to a nine wicket win .
it was his first century in that form of the game at this level .
the bears are back in one day cup action later as they take on notts at trent bridge and you can hear ball-by-ball coverage online .
in case you missed it , read @ twitterid report of last night 's @ twitterid win # youbears

documents.title: more signage needed say motorists after fines
text: tamworth borough council has requested that operators gallan parking provide further signage in the spinning school lane car park after complaints from motorists .
author: Tamworth Herald

documents.title: man suffers from smoke inhalation after fire
text: a man was left requiring medical treatment after a fire broke out during the early hours at a property in walsall .
author: Walsall Advertiser

documents.title: man 'terrified ' after wolverhampton dog attack
text: wm 's top story this morning : a bilston man savaged by a dog as he cycled to work over the weekend says he 's been left terrified by the experience .
stanley ingleton , 61 , ( a dog , thought to be a pit bull , jumped up at him as he rode his bike through the area on saturday morning .
the 61-year-old is now recovering after having 15 stitches to his face .
west midlands police officers say they are investigating and trying to find the dog 's owner .
author: Louise Hancock
Newsreader, BBC WM

documents.title: walk of stars to celebrate birmingham 's athletes
text: british athletics is launching a walk of stars at the alexander stadium in birmingham later to celebrate and recognise outstanding talent in the city .
former commonwealth champion and olympic bronze medal holder kelly sotherton ( be there to receive the first star .
ms sotherton got her bronze medal in the heptathlon in the 2004 olym
author: Nicola Beckford
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: latest headlines : man left terrified after dog attack ; nightclub to review policies after student rape
text: the top stories for birmingham and the black country this morning include :
- a bilston man savaged by a dog as he cycled to work says he 's been left `` terrified '' by the experience
- a birmingham nightclub which was heavily criticised after a student was raped after leaving the premises says it is reviewing its policies .
- warwickshire beat leicestershire at edgbaston in emphatic style in the royal london one day cup
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nightclub to review procedures after rape
text: a birmingham nightclub which was heavily criticised by a judge for `` abandoning '' a drunk student who was later raped when she left the premises says it is reviewing its policies .
a judge sentenced two men last week for the attack on the 19-year-old victim .
she criticised snobs for serving people who were already too drunk and for removing the woman after she 'd collapsed .
snobs have insisted they helped the teenager and that she left the cordoned area outside the club of her own accord .
we will be having a meeting with the police and the council and we will be fully going through our procedures of what we did that night and what we can do to go forward .
author: BBC WM

documents.title: family 'disgusted ' by end of life care plan for mum
text: the family of a 77-year-old woman who was twice put on an end of life care plan by sandwell hospital , but survived , say they 're disgusted with the hospital .
betty boylan from birmingham was given the last rites nearly two years ago , before the family demanded treatment .
this february , her hospital notes said she would n't live for another six weeks .
the hospital say the plan is always in the patient 's best interests and they are never denied food and fluids .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: sunny day ahead with a chance of a shower later
text: it 'll be a mostly fine , warm day with plenty of sunshine .
some showers , perhaps heavy , may develop in places during the afternoon , although most should remain dry with highs of 25c ( 77f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: delays on the roads
text: - one lane is closed on the m6 northbound between j8 m5 and j9 , a461 ( wednesbury ) , because of a broken down vehicle and recovery work
- there 's queuing traffic on the a462 essington road southbound in new invention between the a4124 lichfield road junction and the bentley lane junction
for the latest disruptions visit bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning : live updates for birmingham and the black country
text: i 'm in the bbc wm newsroom today bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates between now and 18:00 .
if you see a story you think we should cover or have captured a of your local area , email us , tweet us or reach us on the bbc wm facebook page .
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live
